title: Fatal Fury Fans Spot Strange Detail In New Trailer, Igniting Generative AI Controversy
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          The use of generative AI in...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                The use of generative AI in video games has been controversial to say the least, but when it comes to art, the blowback has been even stronger. One game currently being accused of using the technology is Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves, as the new trailer for the fighting game's upcoming second season of DLC characters is being picked apart online. Viewers and commenters have pored over the trailer, claiming that the character designs are inconsistent and that certain visual elements contain generative AI. The biggest smoking gun, according to viewers, is a quick shot of series antagonist Geese Howard, who appears to be missing an entire foot.Other instances of generative AI pointed out include Blue Mary's motorcycle missing several vital components--and being a completely different model from what she normally rides--and Kim Jae Hoon having noticeably different wardrobes between his cinematic and gameplay character models. We have reached out to the developer, SNK, for details on the trailer and will update this post as soon as we hear back.          If Fatal Fury is using generative AI, it wouldn't be the first game to do so. Activision confirmed that AI tools were used in the development of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, but it has insisted that the creative process "continues to be led" by humans. Meanwhile, fans believe that Battlefield 6 features AI-generated art, and the Indie Game Awards rescinded the awards given to Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 after it was discovered that developer Sandfall Interactive used AI-generated assets during the game's production.Baldur's Gate 3 developer Larian Studios has also faced backlash after it was revealed that it had been experimenting with AI tools for concept art. Studio CEO Swen Vincke later addressed the controversy and explained that the studio will avoid using generative AI entirely in concept-art creation for its next game, Divinity.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Animal Crossing: New Horizons Adds New Jump, Strafing, And Walking Backwards
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Animal Crossing: New Horizon's...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Animal Crossing: New Horizon's free 3.0 update has dropped earlier than expected, bringing new features including the Slumber Islands, Resort Hotel, and the return of Resetti. One feature players didn't see coming is the brand-new movement system, which allows players to move precisely one square at a time, allowing strafing and even a cute little hop.The new style of movement has been added to aid in construction and decorating. The options are mentioned as part of a tutorial in the Island Designer app, though some players managed to discover the new feature on their own.One player posted to Reddit after finding that pressing L now makes your character jump, while others discovered that this was only part of the new movement function, which allows precise movement one square at a time by pressing and holding L.          Compared to New Horizon's usual free movement mode, the new feature essentially snaps players to the game's grid, which should make decorating, pathbuilding, and general terraforming a much smoother process.Beyond its functionality, the new movements are just fun, with players already planning how they will use the feature's little hops or backwards walks to express themselves in game--why not try moonwalking around town, for one.The new movement scheme is just a small part of the new 3.0 update, which is live in game now. The latest update adds both quality-of-life updates and some new content, intended to clean up the 2020 title ahead of its Switch 2 release on January 15. Already downloaded the update? Check out our guide to what to do first in New Horizons 3.0.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Who's Who In Tomb Raider TV Show
description: By     Eddie Makuch   on January 15, 2026 at 7:57AM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases...
body:
By 
    Eddie Makuch
   on January 15, 2026 at 7:57AM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Prime Video is producing a new Tomb Raider live-action TV show, featuring Game of Thrones star Sophie Turner as Lara Croft. But who else stars in the show, and what roles do they play?In addition to Turner as Croft, the Tomb Raider show features other big names like Harry Potter's Jason Isaacs and Avatar's Sigourney Weaver, among others.Read on to see who's who in the upcoming TV show. But note that the only image from the TV series released so far is of Turner as Croft. The images for other actors in the show come from their previous projects or official headshots.The Tomb Raider show doesn't have a release date, but is now in production.Fleabag's Phoebe Waller-Bridge is the creator, writer, executive producer, and co-showrunner of the Tomb Raider series, alongside Chad Hodge as co-showrunner and executive producer.Jonathan Van Tulleken (Shogun, Dope Thief) is the director and executive producer.As for the game series, The Game Awards in December 2025 brought news of two new Tomb Raider games, including a remake of the 1996 game called Tomb Raider: Legacy of Atlantis coming in 2026 and a new game called Tomb Raider: Catalyst in 2027. These games will feature Alix Wilton Regan in the role of Lara Croft, taking over for Camilla Luddington.Sophie Turner as Lara CroftSophie Turner, who starred on Game of Thrones as Sansa Stark, plays the lead role of Lara Croft in the Tomb Raider show. Prime Video released a first-look image of Turner as Croft on January 15.For her preparation, Turner recently said she has been training up to eight hours a day, five days a week, since February 2025, to physically prepare for the demanding role.She has also been playing the old games and reading the Tomb Raider comics, but she has avoided watching the Tomb Raider movies starring Angelina Jolie so that she can put her own unique spin on the character.Turner follows not only Jolie but also Oscar-winner Alicia Vikander, who played Croft in 2018's Tomb Raider movie.Jason Isaacs as Atlas DeMornayHarry Potter and The White Lotus actor Jason Isaacs will play Atlas DeMornay in the Tomb Raider TV show. He is Lara's uncle.Sigourney Weaver as Evelyn Wallis Academy Award-nominated actor Sigourney Weaver, known for her roles in the Alien and Avatar franchises, will play Evelyn Wallis.Wallis is described as a "mysterious, high-flying woman who is keen to exploit Lara's talents."Bill Paterson as Winston Scottish actor Bill Paterson plays Winston, the Croft family butler, in the Tomb Raider show. Paterson is a veteran actor known for his roles in The Witches, Miss Potter, and How to Lose Friends & Alienate People, among countless other roles spanning a decades-long career in Hollywood. Tomb Raider isn't his first video game project, as Paterson played Ackerson's father in the Halo show.Also of note is that Paterson appeared in nine episodes of Fleabag alongside Waller-Bridge, the creator of the Tomb Raider show.Martin Bobb-Semple as Zip Actor Martin Bobb-Semple plays Zip in the Tomb Raider show. He is "Lara Croft's long-standing tech support and friend."Bobb-Semple is perhaps best known for his recurring roles on All American: Homecoming and One of Us is Lying.Jack Bannon as Gerry Jack Bannon played Gerry on the Tomb Raider show. Gerry is described as "Lara's personal pilot and snack collector." Bannon's best-known role is that of Alfred Pennyworth in the DC TV show Pennyworth. He's also appeared in the TV show Pulse and the movie The Imitation Game. John Heffernan as David Actor John Hefferman plays David in Tomb Raider. David is described as an "exhausted government official who finds himself tangled up in Lara's unusual world."Heffernman is best known for portraying Jaggers in 13 episodes of the TV show Dickensian. He also had roles in Crooked House, Official Secrets, and Eye in the Sky. Credit: Amazon MGM StudiosCelia Imrie as Francine Celia Imrie plays Francine on the Tomb Raider TV show. Francine is "Head of Advancement at the British Museum, focused solely on raising funds and glasses of champagne," according to the show's description.Imrie is known for her roles in The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel, Imagine Me & You, Calendar Girls, and Frankenstein.Paterson Joseph as Thomas Warner Paterson Joseph plays Thomas Warner in the Tomb Raider show. Warner is a "senior government official brought in to clean up an almighty mess."Joseph is known for his roles in Wonka, The Beach, and Aeon Flux. Sasha Luss as Sasha Sasha Luss probably won't have to try too hard to remember her character's name in Tomb Raider, as Sasha Luss will play the character Sasha. She is described as a "fierce, deeply competitive new adversary of Lara's."Luss is known for her roles in Latency, Anna, Sheroes, and Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets. Juliette Motamed as Georgia Juliette Motamed  plays Georgia, a character described as a "devoted, by-the-books curator at the British Museum, dedicated to the 'proper' preservation of history," in the Tomb Raider show.Motamed played Carina in three episodes of the Halo TV show. She also appeared in Magic Mike's Last Dance and the TV show Grace. Image credit: credit Guarionex Rodriguez Jr.August Wittgenstein as LukasAugust Wittgenstein plays Lukas in Tomb Raider. Lukas is described as an "illegal raider who shares history with Lara in more ways than one."Wittgenstein is known for his roles on the TV shows Faithless, Das Boot, and The Crown.Image credit: Marica Rosengard.
